name: Desert Rose Resort

reviews.text: We could not really fault Desert Rose and had booked for 3 nights. We loved the apartment layout and found everything to our satisfaction. The continental breakfast was quite adequate and late afternoon nibbles and drinks good. We used the pool area and had no trouble in finding a sunbed in the afternoon. The location was superb for us as we needed to be near Hooters and MGM for the entertainment that weekend. No trouble walking to the MGM for the monorail to go up the strip. We stayed the following weekend in a four star large hotel on the strip and hated having to walk through the smoky casino for ages to get to our room. We will definitely stay again at the Desert Rose if we return to Las Vegas in the future.
reviews.title: Great for us and will stay again

likes.liked: — No casino and easy to get to your room
likes.disliked: — The breakfast should have gone on to 10 am during the week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Desert Rose resort for a 4 day get away. This is our second time in Las Vegas and enjoyed both times. We stayed at the Rio the first time and the Desert Rose the second. Both are very different experiences and we enjoyed them both.The Desert Rose is just a short 2 block walk off the strip, accesssable but quiet. If you have a physical disability the walk may be too far. The pool and hot tub stay open until 11 pm compared to the strip hotels of 6 pm. It is nice having your own cooking facility. Going out to eat every meal is not my idea of fun. The resort had a nice continental breakfast every morning with a very friendly staff. The concierge was very helpful in printing our flight boarding passes. If you are looking for a retreat to get away from the chaos of the strip (when you choose) at a reasonable price, then this is the place for you. If you want non-stop action then stay on the strip (but pay more money). This was a perfect place if you have a car. No parking fee and easy in and out of your condo.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picketts, Michigan
reviews.title: enjoyed every minute

reviews.text: my husband and Istayed at the desert rose for a week in october. From arrival to leaving we had a lovely time. Staff were very friendly and helpful and our room had everything needed for a comfortable stay. The furnishings were lovely, two large tv's with plenty of channels one in the lounge and one in the bedroom, a large double bed and lovely bathroom. The breakfast was ok with bread, bagels, fruit, cheese etc. Afternoons between 5 and 7 there is entertainment and free wine beer and soft drinks, we only attended once as there is so much to see and do in Vegas. The location is excellent and although the big hotels are amazing I would much rather stay at the Desert Rose as the big hotels seemed so busy and hectic. We had a perfect holiday thanks to all at the Desert Rose we hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

likes.liked: — Suite set-up, separate bedroom, full kitchen

reviews.text: My sister and I just stayed at the Desert Rose Resort Oct 23-27 while attending a family wedding. Enjoyed our stay very much. Rooms were spacious and clean. Kitchen came in really handy, especially the frig magnet with the directions to the nearest grocery stores. LOVED the little Las Vegas Map attached to the key card envelope - we used that map a lot since this trip was our first in about 12 years to Vegas. A/C was a little loud until we figured out how to flip Fan from ON to Auto and it then only ran when needed. Housekeeping service forgot to leave replacement towel items a few times but was fixed quickly.
reviews.title: A Gem of a Place!!!

likes.disliked: — Lack of shuttle to strip after a long day of walking.

reviews.text: Family of four including 15 year old and 12 year old. We arrived very early (due to changed flight) 9am and guy at reception was very accomodating and said they could check us in immediately. Showed us two rooms - first had 2 Queen beds, was clean, tidy and on ground floor. We wanted second room to have twin beds so they showed us another room but this seemed old and drab, also on ground floor with door to roadway which did not have any deadbolts or other than standard ranchslider bolts so I went back and reiterated we would rather wait a couple of hours and get an upper floor room. The guy at reception seemed very unimpressed with my request and looked very annoyed, even though I was extremely polite which was a bit upsetting. I think he sensed he had upset me and calmed down and offered to have a room overlooking strip on second floor made up and ready by 12 but we couldn't get twin beds in the second room as they have hardly any rooms like that. We went to the strip and returned at 4pm. No room had been put aside for us and new receptionist apologised and let us look at a room on 3rd floor with view of strip (as far away from lobby and pool as possible), but it was very nice and clean and we could see Excalibur, Luxor, MGM, Tropicana from our balcony. After that it was great. Room was clean, tidy - the beds were fabulous (this was the third hotel in our trip and by far best beds and pillows). We had two room condo with two bathrooms, three televisions, full kitchen, and dining. My daughter slept on the sofa which was hugely comfortable and all was well. The breakfast in the morning is from 6am to 9am. The earlier you went the better table you got however we went about 7.30am every day and had no problem. We had cereals, toast, bagels, cold boiled eggs, danishes, coffees, hot chocolate and other drinks. Brilliant for free! We went to the mix and mingle drinks and nibbles one evening and it was very pleasant and we talked to people from UK so that was lovely. Pool was small and we didn't use it... every day by 9am all of the deck chairs are taken as people put their towels on them whilst they have breakfast and then sunbathe all day. Hotel is very handy to strip - 10 mins walk maximum to Excalibur, Luxor, MGM and 5 mins to Hooters, Tropicana. We used the $5 each all day bus pass and rode up and down the strip - good value for money but don't expect to get up and down too fast as it stops continuously but cheap sightseeing tour and it goes to the outlet malls too! I would stay here again as excellent large apartments for families compared to hotel rooms. Do NOT use the phone in your room though. I made a 4 minute call to NZ which should have cost about $10 and it cost $42USD. I queried this on checkout and the receptionist told me that the hotel charge about $20 just to dial out an international call and then charge quite a lot per minute and they usually "warn" their customers about this on checkin. (Just got the bill and $72 New Zealand dollars for four mins!!!!)
reviews.title: Good value for money

likes.liked: — Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full facilities, free breakfast
likes.disliked: — Cost of international toll calls, issue checking in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 4th visit to Vegas and by far the best place we have stayed at. We stayed for 4 nights from 12th-16th October and booked way back in January for an amazing price of £36 per night for the room through Expedia.
reviews.title: Glad we went and will return one day

likes.liked: — quietness of location but not far from the action
likes.disliked: — Putting block on my credit card

reviews.text: When we arrived it had been a busy weekend so rooms weren't going to be available until the stated time of 4 pm. We left our bags in the secured storage and went for a walk , an hour later our room was available, block 3 top floor, though there are only 3 floors in each block. It was so nice to be able to arrive at the hotel and be in your room within a few minutes without having to traipse through a casino, especially if you had forgotten something !!
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

likes.liked: — The place wasn't connected to a smoke filled casino

reviews.text: It has been said many times in previous reviews that the rooms are great, they are, everything is provided even down to a small bottle of washing up liquid, and pan scrubber !!! The fridge was huge and typically American in size with automatic ice making facility. Everything was spotless in the kitchen. The living room area was large , there was some staining on the lounging furniture where drinks had been spilled but didn't detract from how homely it all felt. We had a one bedroom unit and it had a walk in closet with an electronic safe which was free to use. The only negative thing was the actual bath and loo area was tiny, anyone of a larger than average size would have to squeeze around the door to close it before using the facilities .
reviews.title: A diamond off of the Strip

reviews.text: The manager's cocktail reception ( 5-7pm ) each evening was a nice touch, there was live music provided by a guy singing with a keyboard, some people actually got up dancing they were having so much fun. Snacks were also provided.
reviews.title: A work in progress

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends whilst visiting Las Vegas for another friend's wedding. It was perfect for what we required - close to the Strip but far enough away that we could escape for some nice peace and quiet when we needed it.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel for a stay in Vegas

reviews.text: We weren't sure what to expect as we'd paid so much less than others that had travelled out for the wedding and were staying on the Strip, but we were so glad we were staying here and not at some of the cheaper, more run down hotels that sell themselves on their novelty value.
reviews.title: Disapointment at the Desert Rose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and there was more than enough room for the 3 of us. The beds were really comfortable; fabulous kitchen (not that we really used it!); lovely to have a balcony and be able to get some fresh air (in many of the strip hotels you can't even open the window). We were also pretty impressed with the breakfast - nothing too fancy but just what we needed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at the Desert Rose

likes.liked: — Great Room, Good Location and Free breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only possible downside is that it's quite close to the airport, but the noise is minimal and it didn't bother us at all. It also means that you can be at the hotel really quickly and don't have to leave too early to get there to go home!
reviews.title: Just excellent
Third trip to Desert Rose
reviews.text: The staff were also really friendly and helpful. We'd definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our accommodation over 3 months in advance, followed up by a mail to the resort specifically requesting a 3rd floor suite, which was responded to accordingly. On checking in after a ten hour flight we were dismayed to find that a ground floor suite had been allocated and that a third floor one "may" be available in an hour. On showing a copy of our e-mail we were informed that this was a request only and could not be guarenteed! At this point the customer service manager Jeremy got involved an admitted that our request had not been acted upon and sourced third floor accommodation in 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Nearly excellent, but a few concerns

likes.disliked: — Not taking account of our request

reviews.text: The 2 bedroom suite was roomy, spotlessly clean and the beds very comfortable. The 5-7pm happy hour was excellent and the breakfast very acceptable. The small gym was adequate, we didn't try the pool. The maid service to service the rooms tended to be late in the day (3pm) but was not an issue. On 2 occasions we were called to ask if we required the room servicing!
reviews.title: Not the best place to stay

reviews.text: On one occasion the lights failed in the bathroom and a maintenance man was quickly summoned to fix it.
reviews.title: Satisfied,but cranky with a few things.

reviews.text: The conciege staff were very friendly, but did not seem to possess a great deal of local knowledge!
reviews.title: great place to stay
good space/well equipped at the desert rose in vegas
reviews.text: I was interested in the comment from a fellow reviewer that their card was blocked, possibly by the resort pending any extras. We took plenty of cash and travellers cheques, but when they ran out I found that my card was blocked, even though i had plenty of credit. Whether this was down to the resort or not I am unsure, but it does seem strange. Also 2 attempts to draw cash which were unsuccessful resulted in withdrawals appearing on my account which are now being disputed. Again, I cannot state that this is anything to do with the resort, but if hotels are blocking cards in this fashion without advising their guests this is clearly unacceptable.

description: Located 1.5 blocks from the Las Vegas Strip, Desert Rose Resort provides you with great access to all the glitz and glam of Las Vegas along with all the gracious pleasures of a resort hotel. Settle into one and two-bedroom condo suites in Las Vegas with fully equipped kitchens and comfortable living and dining areas – all beautifully decorated with sleek, contemporary furnishings and a rich color palette. Desert Rose Resort’s pool is an oasis, a truly relaxing and refreshing hideaway – dramatically different from the crush of people at some Vegas hotels. Each morning enjoy a complimentary continental breakfast buffet. Monday through Thursday, enjoy complimentary afternoon "manager’s reception" with refreshments and beverages. Lucky you, Desert Rose Resort is a winning deal in Las Vegas - without stepping foot in a casino.
